alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 12:29AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Kenedy, eastern Hidalgo, northwestern Cameron and Willacy Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1229 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near San Perlita to near Dishman Elementary School to Doctor Hesiquio Rodriguez Elementary School. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, Raymondville, La Feria, Santa Rosa, Lyford, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley and Arroyo City. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 9 and 51. US Highway 77 between mile markers 760 and 762. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Cameron; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy
